Class VecUtil

equal

public static boolean equal(VectorIntf x,
                            VectorIntf y)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Parameters:
x - VectorIntf
y - VectorIntf
Returns:
boolean true iff all the components of the vectors x and y are equal (so that for each component i, the comparison xi==yi returns true). Returns false if the two vectors have different lengths.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x & y are both null

getCosineSimilarityDistance

public static double getCosineSimilarityDistance(VectorIntf x,
                                                 VectorIntf y)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
return the cosine-similarity between x and y (ie the cos(x/\y)) used in Information Retrieval. This similarity measure is not a "distance" measure, as the more "similar" two vectors are, the greater the returned value of this method.

Parameters:
x - VectorIntf
y - VectorIntf
Returns:
double
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if x or y are null or if one of the two is the zero vector, or if the two vectors' dimensions don't agree.

getJaccardDistance

public static double getJaccardDistance(VectorIntf x,
                                        VectorIntf y)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
return the Jaccard distance measure between two vectors. Also known as the Tanimoto distance measure (used in Information Retrieval, Recommender Systems etc.)

Parameters:
x - VectorIntf
y - VectorIntf
Returns:
double
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
